page.title: 11Transport
page.content: Public Transport is limited. The railway line from Ashford to Canterbury passes through but does not stop between Wye and Chilham. The East Kent Bus Company run a fairly regular bus service on the one main road from Ashford to Canterbury which runs through Bilting. Most other roads are country lanes, some quite narrow in places so that wider strips have been made to allow traffic to pass. Crundale has no actual bus service but the post bus has seats and , after delivering the mail,will take people to Canterbury at 9.00am, returning with the afternoon mail. Other travel has to be by car, bicycle, tractor or on foot.
